children.subject: Unfortunately, the DARE application hasn't gone live yet, so the project list is not yet available there. When you join the virtual event tomorrow, there will be a directory with the titles of every project listed. You can then visit posters for each of the projects that you're interested in, where a full description will be available, and where you can video chat with the grad student offering the project. Once the DARE portal opens, you'll be able to see all the project descriptions there as well.

Could someone point me to the list of available projects to be presented at the event? I've looked at both the DARE portal (https://deptapps.coe.berkeley.edu/dare/apply/) and the Google Form on the DARE website as well, and couldn't seem to find it. Thanks!
Will there be a similar event in spring?

history.content:
Hi All,
RISELab will be holding a gather.town virtual event on Friday, 9/11 from 1-2pm PT to recruit new undergraduate researchers. At the event, you can:
* Talk to RISELab graduate students about research projects you could work on.
* Get general advice on doing research from students and faculty in 1-on-1 or small-group settings.
* Talk to current RISELab undergrads, who will present their research and their experiences doing research in RISE.
Link to event page: https://www.virtualchair.net/event-riselab
Everyone is welcome to this event, even if you aren't sure you want to do research!
For those of you interested in getting involved with research, we will soon begin soliciting applications on a rolling basis through DARE. The application portal will include a list of available projects that will be presented at the event on 9/11 -- feel free to check it out before the event so you know which grad students to talk to.
Hope to see you there!
Daniel Rothchild
history.subject: RISELab Research Event on Friday, September 11
